page.title: 10THE WILDLIFE OF CASSOP VALE
page.content: Cassop Vale is a large valley in the Magnesian Limestone.It's steep sides and shallow soil make ploughing impossible.Each side has a different habitat.The South facing side is a warm habitat,the North cool.It is one of the few remaining untouched grasslands and is an S.S.S.I. On the valley floor is a large pond which attracts waterhens,snipe,mallard and occasionally herons.There are dragon flies,amphibians and roach.The wooded sides are mainly ash with some hazel and guelder rose.Beneath grow wood anemonies,woodruff and herb paris.The grassland is the important part.There are lots of flowers: cowslips,thyme, trefoil,butterwort and several orchids (early purple,frog,fragrant etc.)Later knapweed,harebells & scabious flower. The flowers attract many butterflies like the orangetip,small blue & argus.
